title: 110_s1108
content: The Act titled "Medicare Part D Outreach and Enrollment Enhancement Act of 2007" provides a special enrollment period for individuals eligible for an income-related subsidy. The "Medicare Part D Outreach and Enrollment Enhancement Act of 2007" introduces a special enrollment period for individuals eligible for a low-income subsidy under Section 1860D-1(b)(3) of the Social Security Act. Eligibility is based on being a part D eligible individual determined to be a subsidy-eligible individual. The "Medicare Part D Outreach and Enrollment Enhancement Act of 2007" introduces a special enrollment period for subsidy-eligible individuals under Section 1860D-1(b)(3) of the Social Security Act. The special enrollment period lasts for 90 days from the date of notification of eligibility. Additionally, the enrollment process for subsidy-eligible individuals includes specific provisions for applicable individuals. During a 90-day period, subsidy-eligible individuals are facilitated in enrolling in the most suitable prescription drug plan or MA-PD plan as determined by the Secretary, unless they decline or choose another plan. During a 90-day period, subsidy-eligible individuals can enroll in a prescription drug plan or MA-PD plan chosen by the individual. They also have the option to change enrollment at least once during a plan year without penalty. Effective January 1, 2008, subsidy-eligible individuals will not face a premium increase in their monthly beneficiary premium under part D. SEC. 3. OUTREACH AND EDUCATION FOR PREMIUM AND COST-SHARING SUBSIDIES UNDER PART D. Additional funding is authorized for outreach and assistance programs related to Medicare. This includes grants to State Health Insurance Assistance Programs (SHIPs) and a national center for senior benefits outreach and enrollment. Additional funding of $4,000,000 is allocated to the National Center on Senior Benefits Outreach and Enrollment for providing assistance with Medicare prescription drug program subsidies. Coordination with State activities is required. The Secretary of Health and Human Services encourages States to direct eligible individuals to organizations providing assistance with applying for premium and cost-sharing subsidies under the Social Security Act. This includes enrolling in prescription drug plans under Medicare. The PD plan under part D of title XVIII of the Social Security Act defines applicable individuals as those eligible for premium and cost-sharing subsidies under section 1860D-14. SEC. 4. Screening by Commissioner of Social Security for eligibility under Medicare Savings Programs. The Social Security Act is amended to include screening for eligibility for medical assistance for medicare cost-sharing. The Commissioner will transmit relevant information to the State Medicaid agency for enrollment under the State plan. The amendment will take effect upon enactment of the Act. The Administration on Aging will conduct a study and report on screening processes used by government needs-based programs. The Assistant Secretary of the Administration on Aging will conduct a study to assess screening processes used by government needs-based programs, including identifying duplications of effort, exploring the feasibility of a uniform screening process, and improving coordination among federal, state, and community-based organizations to facilitate senior enrollment in need-based programs. The Assistant Secretary will submit a report to Congress within 1 year, containing study results on screening processes for government needs-based programs. Recommendations will focus on streamlining processes and proposing legislative or administrative actions. Authorization is granted for necessary funds to implement the recommendations proposed by the Assistant Secretary in a report to Congress within 1 year.
